glytoucan_ac.description: GlyTouCan accession number of the glycan.

mass.description: Native mass of the glycan. If the glycan has a modification (e.g. sulfation, reducing end) it will have the corresponding mass

classification.description: A list of classifiers for the glycan (e.g. Bisection N-Glycan, Acidic glycan)

name.description: This field is set if a search by glycan type (e.g. N-Glycan) will be performed. The complete list of glycan types is maintained by the glygen server.

url.description: URL that links to the explaination of the type

name.description: This field is set if a search by glycan subtype (e.g. bisection) will be performed. The complete list of glycan subtypes is maintained by the glygen server. This field can be used intependendly from glycan_type and does not need to be used in combination.

url.description: URL that links to the explaination of the subtype

species.description: A list of species entries this glycan was reported in. The objects in this list do also contain the databases and their entry IDs that reported this annotation.

name.description: Scientific name of the species from NCBI Taxonomy.

taxid.description: Taxonomy ID of the species (NCBI Taxonomy)

evidence.description: A list of database references that reported this annotation. Each object contains of the name of the database, the database ID and URL.

id.description: ID or the entry in the database

url.description: URL of the database entry. For non-public databases this field may not be present.

motifs.description: List of motifs that have been found in the glycan structure.

iupac.description: IUPAC sequence of the glycan. This sequence may not always be present since not all glycans can be represented in IUPAC.

wurcs.description: Sequence of the glycan in WURCS format. This sequence will always be present.

glycoct.description: GlycoCT sequence of the glycan. This sequence may not always be present.

crossref.description: List of references in other databases for the glycan structures. For each entry the name, the entry ID in the database and if available an URL is given.

id.description: ID or the entry in the database

URL.description: URL of the database entry. For non-public databases this field may not be present.

glycoprotein.description: List of glycosylation sites the glycan has been reported on. The protein and if available the glycosylation postion is given together with references to reporting databases

protein_name.description: Name of the protein/enzyme from Uniprot.

position.description: Position of the glycosylated aminoacide the glycan was attached to

evidence.description: A list of database references that reported this annotation. Each object contains of the name of the database, the database ID and URL.

id.description: ID or the entry in the database

url.description: URL of the database entry. For non-public databases this field may not be present.

enzymes.description: List of enzymes that might be involved in the synthesis of the glycan. This annotation is present if one or many enzymes can add a certain monosaccharide to the glycan. However which of the alternative enzymes was really at work is not specified.

protein_name.description: Name of the protein/enzyme from Uniprot.
